Act4Scene3.speaker: Malcolm
Act4Scene3.text: Let us seek out some desolate shade and there weep our sad bosoms empty.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Macduff
Act4Scene3.text: Let us rather hold fast the mortal sword and, like good men, bestride our downfall’n birthdom.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Malcolm
Act4Scene3.text: What I believe, I’ll wail; What know, believe; and what I can redress, As I shall find the time to friend, I will.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Malcolm
Act4Scene3.text: What you have spoke, it may be so, perchance. This tyrant Was once thought honest.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Malcolm
Act4Scene3.text: I am young, but something You may deserve of him through me, and wisdom To offer up a weak, poor, innocent lamb T’ appease an angry god.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Macduff
Act4Scene3.text: I am not treacherous.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Malcolm
Act4Scene3.text: But Macbeth is. A good and virtuous nature may recoil In an imperial charge. But I shall crave your pardon.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Macduff
Act4Scene3.text: I have lost my hopes.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Malcolm
Act4Scene3.text: Perchance even there where I did find my doubts. Why in that rawness left you wife and child Without leave-taking? I pray you, Let not my jealousies be your dishonors, But mine own safeties. You may be rightly just, Whatever I shall think.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Macduff
Act4Scene3.text: Bleed, bleed, poor country! Great tyranny, lay thou thy basis sure, For goodness dare not check thee. Wear thou thy wrongs; The title is affeered.—Fare thee well, lord. I would not be the villain that thou think’st For the whole space that’s in the tyrant’s grasp, And the rich East to boot.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Malcolm
Act4Scene3.text: Be not offended. I speak not as in absolute fear of you. I think our country sinks beneath the yoke.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Malcolm
Act4Scene3.text: Well, more anon.— Comes the King forth, I pray you?

Act4Scene3.speaker: Doctor
Act4Scene3.text: Ay, sir. There are a crew of wretched souls That stay his cure.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Malcolm
Act4Scene3.text: I thank you, doctor.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Macduff
Act4Scene3.text: What’s the disease he means?

Act4Scene3.speaker: Malcolm
Act4Scene3.text: ’Tis called the evil: A most miraculous work in this good king, Which often since my here-remain in England I have seen him do.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Macduff
Act4Scene3.text: See who comes here.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Malcolm
Act4Scene3.text: My countryman, but yet I know him not.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Macduff
Act4Scene3.text: My ever-gentle cousin, welcome hither.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Malcolm
Act4Scene3.text: I know him now.—Good God betimes remove The means that makes us strangers!

Act4Scene3.speaker: Ross
Act4Scene3.text: Sir, amen.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Macduff
Act4Scene3.text: Stands Scotland where it did?

Act4Scene3.speaker: Ross
Act4Scene3.text: Alas, poor country, Almost afraid to know itself.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Macduff
Act4Scene3.text: O relation too nice and yet too true!

Act4Scene3.speaker: Malcolm
Act4Scene3.text: What’s the newest grief?

Act4Scene3.speaker: Ross
Act4Scene3.text: That of an hour’s age doth hiss the speaker. Each minute teems a new one.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Macduff
Act4Scene3.text: How does my wife?

Act4Scene3.speaker: Ross
Act4Scene3.text: Why, well.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Macduff
Act4Scene3.text: And all my children?

Act4Scene3.speaker: Ross
Act4Scene3.text: Well too.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Macduff
Act4Scene3.text: The tyrant has not battered at their peace?

Act4Scene3.speaker: Ross
Act4Scene3.text: No, they were well at peace when I did leave ’em.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Macduff
Act4Scene3.text: Be not a niggard of your speech. How goes ’t?

Act4Scene3.speaker: Ross
Act4Scene3.text: When I came hither to transport the tidings Which I have heavily borne, there ran a rumor Of many worthy fellows that were out.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Malcolm
Act4Scene3.text: Be ’t their comfort We are coming thither.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Ross
Act4Scene3.text: Would I could answer This comfort with the like. But I have words That would be howled out in the desert air, Where hearing should not latch them.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Macduff
Act4Scene3.text: What concern they— The general cause, or is it a fee-grief Due to some single breast?

Act4Scene3.speaker: Ross
Act4Scene3.text: But in it shares some woe, though the main part Pertains to you alone.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Macduff
Act4Scene3.text: If it be mine, Keep it not from me.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Ross
Act4Scene3.text: Your castle is surprised, your wife and babes Savagely slaughtered.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Malcolm
Act4Scene3.text: Merciful heaven!— What, man, ne’er pull your hat upon your brows.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Macduff
Act4Scene3.text: My children too?

Act4Scene3.speaker: Ross
Act4Scene3.text: Wife, children, servants, all that could be found.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Macduff
Act4Scene3.text: And I must be from thence? My wife killed too?

Act4Scene3.speaker: Ross
Act4Scene3.text: I have said.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Malcolm
Act4Scene3.text: Be comforted. Let’s make us med’cines of our great revenge To cure this deadly grief.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Macduff
Act4Scene3.text: All my pretty chickens and their dam At one fell swoop?

Act4Scene3.speaker: Malcolm
Act4Scene3.text: Dispute it like a man.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Macduff
Act4Scene3.text: I shall do so, But I must also feel it as a man. I cannot but remember such things were That were most precious to me. Heaven rest them now.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Malcolm
Act4Scene3.text: Be this the whetstone of your sword. Let grief Convert to anger. Blunt not the heart; enrage it.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Macduff
Act4Scene3.text: O, I could play the woman with mine eyes And braggart with my tongue! Front to front Bring thou this fiend of Scotland and myself. Within my sword’s length set him.

Act4Scene3.speaker: Malcolm
Act4Scene3.text: This tune goes manly. Come, go we to the King. Macbeth Is ripe for shaking, and the powers above Put on their instruments. Receive what cheer you may. The night is long that never finds the day.
